reviewText:
========================================

Vince Rowe ReviewsSaving the Industry one Game at a Time!

[YouTube Link]   [Curation Link]

========================================


A nonsensical Point 'n' Click but a fun one that doesn't take itself too seriously!
Verdict - 7.3/10
Scroll to the bottom for an 'Overall' on the game.


Gameplay - 7/10:
When it comes to Point 'n' Click adventure games; there's not really much to them. You can pretty much boil them down to 3 sections: Gameplay, Story, and Graphics. Luckily for Point 'n' Click games though, these sections can be very diverse topics! So, Ballads of Reemus, the best way to put the gameplay - such as the puzzles and the overall progression of the game - is that it's nonsensical. By this I mean that it's some of the puzzles, and ways to obtain a certain item don't make sense and are... 'Convenient', however, it's not a bad thing, it adds humour the game. Overall, the gameplay is alright, just a little... Random.


Story - 9/10:
The story is as nonsensical as the puzzles! The characters are great with some good voice acting accompanying them, the progression through the world is great and it takes you to some weird places. The entire world is basically based on taking sayings literally, so for example, the 'Bed Bugs' are massive cockroaches that just sleep all day... And the horse flies... I think you can guess at this point. Overall, I really love the world this is based in, it's basically if a pre-schooler made up their own ideal world with Ice Cream Cacti and Breakfast Trees!


Graphics - 6/10:
There's not really much to say about the graphics except that it they really remind you of the old school Flash Style, the type you've seen on Newgrounds... In all honesty, I really like these graphics just because of how 'crisp' they look!


Overall - 7.3/10:
I like this game, maybe it's because it's one of the first Point 'n' Click games I've played for a while... Regardless, I enjoyed it, and if you're a fan of Point 'n' Click games then I think you will too! It's about 3 hours long by the way.

- reappearances of known characters (if you played Several Journeys of Reemus)
- Mini-Sidequests" (clicking on pieces of something scattered around and then putting them together)

Con:

- no hot-spot feature

reviewText: Really fun little point-and-click adventure based off  of the Ballad of Reemus flash games. Little on the shorter side with me finished it in three hours but I'd say it was worth the price. Nice voice acting and pretty entertaining story and puzzles. Would recommend playing the 5 or so flash games first and if you enjoyed them you'll enjoy this one.

reviewText: This is a fun, but short, adventure game that has a bit of extra content to give you a reason to go back and play bits of it again. If you're looking for an adventure game to spend the afternoon or an evening on, give this a shot.

reviewText:
Αν η αναλογία των €5 για 3 ώρες gaming χρόνου σας φαντάζει ως τίμια πρόταση και με την προϋπόθεση ότι ένα adventure game που δε θα σας κάνει να κολλήσετε πουθενά δε θα σας απογοητεύσει, το παιχνίδι της ClickShake Games θα σας κάνει να περάσετε πολύ όμορφα μαζί του. Διαθέτει έναν πρωταγωνιστή που είναι πραγματικά σκέτη μορφή, καθώς κι έναν συμπαθέστατο sidekick χαρακτήρα. Τα voice overs είναι απολαυστικά, μ’ εμφανή την επιτηδευμένη υπερβολή τους σ’ ορισμένα σημεία.

A short, easy and very pleasant adventure game, that will not make you get stuck anywhere during its 3-hour length. If you are OK with that, do not hesitate to give 5 euros in order to make it yours.

reviewText: The writing isn't amazingly clever or anything, but it doesn't do anything incredibly stupid or cringeworthy either. The puzzles aren't brilliant, but they also don't tend to make you sit there banging every object in the game against each other hoping to stumble over the creator's insane moon logic. The art and music and voice acting have their moments. It's alright, but it doesn't quite make it from this is not bad" to "this is actively good" as often as I'd like. It was an ok couple of hours though."

Awesome game, that's for sure, awesomeness from Zeebarf himself, but the fact that you have to pay for the game and that it's shorter than the Several Journeys of Reemus 4 is ridiculous.
I recommend it solely for the fact that it's a freaking Jay Zeebarf game, but you should definitely pick it up when it's alot cheaper: $5 is NOT worth 1 hour of point and click gameplay.

Honestly, I recommend playing The Several Journeys of Reemus 1, 2, 3 and 4 before you play this.
Also, there is already a sequel being made called The Ballads of Reemus 2"

reviewText: Don't play too many point and click. This game was great. Easy to follow story, puzzles range from easy to med/hard.\nFun animation. finished in about 5 hours over 3 days.

The writing isn't amazingly clever or anything, but it doesn't do anything incredibly stupid or cringeworthy either. The puzzles aren't brilliant, but they also don't tend to make you sit there banging every object in the game against each other hoping to stumble over the creator's insane moon logic. The art and music and voice acting have their moments. It's alright, but it doesn't quite make it from this is not bad" to "this is actively good" as often as I'd like. It was an ok couple of hours though."

If you have ever played any of the Reemus games on Newgrounds you will not be disappointed. This game is a much bigger adventure starring your favorite exterminator and his bear buddy. A big difference from this game is that it plays a lot more like old click and play games in which you have to travel from different locations to gather objects rather than staying on one screen at a time and voice acting. If you enjoy the Reemus games then this is a must buy. If you are new to the Reemus series I suggest you play the games on Newgrounds before considering buying the game. Whether you're new to the series or not the game contains many laughs and brain teasing puzzles you'd expect from click and play games.

I've been a fan of Zeebarf's since I was in highschool when The Reemus vs deathslugs saga was uploaded to newgrounds. I like the humor in this one and it was easy enough to beat although there were at least 3 puzzles that gave me a hard time most of them were easy to figure out without a walkthrough a rarity in Point & Click games. I look forward to seeing more of his work.
